intro: Meryta macrocephala, commonly known as the giant meryta, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive tubular shape that attracts pollinators like birds and insects. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
